stem: A 22-year-old patient presented with a sore throat and fatigue. On examination, there is cervical lymphadenopathy and hepatosplenomegaly. Epstein bar antibody is positive. What is your diagnosis?
disc:
Clinical manifestations of infectious mononucleosis include sore throat, fever, fatigue, and cervical lymphadenopathy. 

An important causative agent is Epstein Bar Virus. It's common around the world and 90% of adults become positive for EBV antibodies by the age of 30 years. The most common way of transmission is by kissing. Additional modes include solid organ transplantation and blood transfusions.
